page.title: 03The Hedgerow around Langford
page.content: We measured a ten metre section of the hedgerow alongside one of the roads leading into Langford.We found out what kind of plants were growing in each metre of the section.We identified three parts:the hedge,the wild uncut, and the regularly cut grass. The hedge consisted of birch bushes with elder, dogrose and bramble. The wild uncut section was mainly great willowherb with nettles, goose- grass, convolvulus, some wild hop and white bryony. The cut grass verge next to the road was meadow grass with other types of grasses, silverweed, hogweed, thistles, small convolvulus and a section of black medick, buttercup, clover, common vetch, cow parsley, yarrow, sow thistle , dock, ground ivy, speedwell, plantin, forget-me-nots and dandelion. (June 1985)
